blocks.value: St. Crescentius was a young boy who was martyred for his Christian faith during the persecution of Diocletian in the early 4th century. According to tradition, Crescentius was only about 11 or 12 years old when he openly professed his faith in Jesus Christ.
Courage in the Face of Death

Despite his young age, Crescentius showed remarkable courage and refused to deny Christ or offer sacrifice to pagan gods. He was arrested and subjected to various tortures. When he still refused to renounce his faith, he was beheaded. His feast is celebrated on September 14th.
